content:
With Lean 3 I would often run leanproject get-mathlib-cache. Do you recommend performing something similar with Lean 4?

I have only just installed it this afternoon and it works fine, but then depending on the Lean 4 file I work on, it takes a bit of time upon first opening, to build the imported libraries.
lake exe cache get is the equivalent command
Both for Mathlib and projects using Mathlib? (what used to be leanproject get-cache and leanproject get-mathlib-cache)
I actually got impatient and I opened another lean 4 file without noticing that the first line was import Mathlib so now I'm waiting until it's done :sweat_smile:
Yes, both for mathlib and projects using mathlib. But you have to make sure lean is not compiling other stuff while running the above command.
import Mathlib should be super quick after lake exe cache get has done its thing

Yes but, silly me, I did not wait for Mauricio's answer before opening the next file that I wanted to explore...and now I am reluctant to just close the file or stop the build abruptly somehow. Iit seems to be quicker than I what I remember in Lean 3, though, so I'm hoping it will be over soon.
There will be no problem closing the file or stopping the build, you can just exit everything. Just make sure you don't have any changed files and then run lake exe cache get again.
A full mathlib build takes roughly 2 hours in CI. As Kevin said, getting the cache is still a good idea.
Oh, thanks! Worked like a charm indeed :-)
Flo (Florent Schaffhauser) has marked this topic as resolved.
